means: 令人困惑地，使人迷乱地

sentence.Network_en: The cast of characters in the scandal is bewilderingly large.
sentence.Network_cn: 卷入丑闻的人多得让人眼花缭乱。
形势非常不明朗,令人琢磨不定.

sentence.Network_en: The ballet we saw yesterday is bewilderingly beautiful.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们昨天观赏的芭蕾舞美得令人入迷.

PerfectNetExp.abs: bewildering 令人困惑的bewilderingly 令人困惑地bewilderment 困惑
the ballet we saw yesterday is bewilderingly beautiful ., 我们昨天观赏的芭蕾舞美得令人入迷.
her situation was bewilderingly unclear .她的情形令人迷惑，搞不清楚。

list.abs: ～+副词puzzle bewilderingly 使人迷惑不解puzzle completely 使人彻底地迷惑不解

entry.tran: 令人困惑的；令人不知所措的；让人晕头转向的
entry.def: A bewildering thing or situation is very confusing and difficult to understand or to make a decision about.

example.ex: A glance along his bookshelves reveals a bewildering array of interests...
example.tran: 看一眼他的书架就知道他兴趣繁杂。

example.ex: The choice of excursions was bewildering.
example.tran: 各种各样可供选择的远足项目让人眼花缭乱。

means.word_mean: 1. in a bewildering and confusing manner;

auth_sentence.content: This makes some of the notes in her edition bewilderingly latitudinarian she nods to Zipes, to Bettelheim, to Gilbert and Gubar.
auth_sentence.res_content: This makes some of the notes in her edition bewilderingly latitudinarian she nods to Zipes, to Bettelheim, to Gilbert and Gubar.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This makes some of the notes in her edition bewilderingly latitudinarian she nods to Zipes, to Bettelheim, to Gilbert and Gubar.
